title: What does 'Principal' means as a job title? - Quora

response.answer_text: First understand that if you are talking about software engineering, then all corporate titles are more or less made up “Principal” engineer is generally someone who is an individual contributor, and is more experienced than a Senior software engineer. S/he is usually assigned to one project at a time, and doesn’t contribute to multiple teams In software engineering, there are 2 tracks, technical track and management track. Generally, tracks diverge after senior software engineer. If you are on a Management track, you will probably go to be Junior software engineer → Software engineer → Senior Software engineer → Team lead → Scrum master → Project/Product Manager → Director → VP If you are on a technical track you go Junior software engineer → Software engineer → Senior Software engineer → Principal Software engineer → Architect → Senior Architect → Enterprise Architect Until you are Principal Software engineer, you are focused on one project. You will be expected to provide some technical guidance to members of your team. When you go into being an “Architect”, you are expected to help out in multiple projects Again, titles in Software engineering jobs are more or less bullshit. A Principal is called principal just so everyone in the team knows that the guy knows his/her stuff. Also may times this happens. There are 2 guys, A & B who started in the company together. A is more technically competent. B is more competent with people. Both progress upto Sneior software engineer together. Since, A is more technically competent, he keeps getting more and more interesting stuff, which keeps him happy. Eventually, B gets promoted to “Team Lead”. Now, A is not happy, because it seems like A wasn’t promoted, even though A is technically competent. He is still getting the interesting projects and everything, but he doesn;t have a new title to go with it. So, corporations come up with a new bullshit title: “Principal Software Engineer. Here, you are promoted. happy now? Oh yes, btw, now that you are “principal” step out of your cube little bit and help other people too”

The term “Principal” when used as a job title or in business, usually means an early investor or originator of the company. It is usually someone that has a good bit of decision making authority over the company with which they are associated. It is usually not the inventor or founder, but someone important that entered the company early or in a substantial way.
